item.title: Lie Groups
item.description: Definition1 A group $G$ is called a Lie group if it satisfies the following conditions: It has a differentiable structure. The binary operation $\cdot : G \times G \to G$ defined in $G$ is differentiable. The inverse ${}^{-1} : G \to G$ is differentiable. Explanation Simply put, a Lie group is a differentiable group.
